summary: In Topics 8.3 and 8.4 we discussed the dynamics of individual populations. Topic 8.5 begins to take a look at the bigger picture and covers interactions between these populations of different species.

vocab.definition: All the populations of different species that live and interact within a particular area or habitat
A metric used in ecology to quantify species diversity in a community by considering both the number of species and their evenness
The total number of different species found in a given area or community
Describes the proportion of one species compared to all other species in an ecosystem
Competition between different species; occurs when two or more species require the same limited resources, such as food, water, or space
An ecological concept stating that two species occupying the exact same ecological niche cannot coexist indefinitely; one species will eventually outcompete the other
The complete set of environmental conditions and resources in which a species could potentially survive and reproduce, without any interference from other species
The actual set of resources, habitat, and environmental conditions that a species occupies and uses
An ecological process where competing species reduce competition and increase coexistence by utilizing different aspects of a limited resource, leading to greater biodiversity
An interaction where one organism (the predator) hunts, kills, and consumes another organism (the prey) for food
The act of animals eating plants
An ecological effect that propagates down the food chain
A natural system of interconnected food chains that illustrates the flow of energy through an ecosystem by showing which organisms are eaten by others
A symbiotic relationship where one organism, the parasite, lives on or inside another organism, the host, benefiting by taking nutrients or resources at the host's expense
A biological and ecological symbiotic relationship where two different species benefit from the interaction, often for survival or reproduction
An association between two organisms in which one benefits and the other derives neither benefit nor harm
